comment: Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Brotherxandepuss|Brotherxandepuss]] ([[User talk:Brotherxandepuss|talk]]): Circular definition. ([[WP:TW|TW]])

diff.*:
Line 3: Line 3:  
{{lead too short|date=October 2012}}
 
{{lead too short|date=October 2012}}
    −
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending theories that seek to define the parameters of ethical [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character". Ethics is a complement to [[Aesthetics]] in the philosophy field of [[Axiology]]. In philosophy, ethics studies the moral behavior in humans, and how one should act.
+
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character". Ethics is a complement to [[Aesthetics]] in the philosophy field of [[Axiology]]. In philosophy, ethics studies the moral behavior in humans, and how one should act.
 
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
